revised_title: The Origins and Development of the Frank-Read Source in Solid State Physics
tldr: The article discusses the origins and development of the Frank-Read source in solid state physics. It highlights the contributions of Sir Charles Frank and Sir Nevill Mott, who independently came up with the idea of the Frank-Read source, which is a process that preserves and multiplies dislocations in crystals. The article also explains how their ideas were influenced by the work of other scientists and how they eventually collaborated to publish a joint paper on the topic.
